title: The Scroll of Print
subtitle: Your First Spell
description:
# Welcome to Fantasy Quest!

You've discovered an ancient scroll that contains the most fundamental spell in all of programming: **the print spell**.

This spell allows you to display messages to the console - a magical window where your code speaks to you.

## The Print Spell

In Python, the print spell looks like this:

```python
print("Hello, adventurer!")
```

**How it works:**
- `print` is the spell name
- The parentheses `()` hold the message you want to display
- The quotation marks `""` tell Python this is text (called a **string**)

## Your Quest

Cast the print spell to display the message:

**Welcome to Fantasy Quest!**

Then, on a new line, cast another print spell to display:

**I am ready to learn coding!**

# Cast your print spells here

hints: Use the print() function twice - once for each message
Don't forget the quotation marks around your text: print("like this")
Make sure each print statement is on its own line
Check your spelling - 'print' is all lowercase
Copy the exact messages: 'Welcome to Fantasy Quest!' and 'I am ready to learn coding!'
